prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: This science goal aims at Band 4 imaging of one or more DSFGs selected in ACT 220 GHz data.

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: The goal of the imaging is to maximize S/N of the continuum, therefore we average the spectrum over the largest bandwidth available (7.5 GHz).

The approximate size physical size of our sources is 2 kpc. With anticipated source redshift z=2-6, an unmagnified source size is ~0.3". This sets the smallest angular scale required, whether we are resolving multiple different sources or resolving the thin dimension of an Einstein ring associated with a single source. The largest angular scale is associated with the Einstein ring of lenses (M~10^12 M_sun) in the redshift range z=.2-1.5. This scale is 3", which is our requested maximum resolvable scale. The >=38" HPBW of the 145 GHz observations is also appropriate given the ACT 5" astrometric precision (with even higher precision for more than half the sample from SMA and other follow-up).

The faintest source in our sample is 16.6 mJy at 220 GHz as observed by ACT, which has arcminute resolution. Scaled with a spectral index of 3.5 to 145 GHz, the expected flux is 3.85 mJy. We expect the source solid angle to be smaller than 2 square arcseconds (whether sources are lensed or resolve into multiple different sources), and our requested resolution is 0.3 arcseconds. Therefore the flux per ALMA 0.3" beam is expected to be ~0.175 mJy. The requested 0.035 mJy RMS limit to obtain S/N >= 5 for all sources. This S/N is needed to effectively model lensing in thin (0.3") arcs.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: We propose high-resolution 145 GHz imaging with ALMA of 28 rare, millimeter-bright dusty star forming galaxies (DSFGs) detected by the Atacama Cosmology Telescope (ACT). The proposed imaging will disentangle the lensed and protocluster/merger DSFG subpopulations, thereby providing insight into galaxy formation at the earliest epochs.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:relatedProposals: (1) An efficient redshift search for ACT star-forming galaxies, PI R. Dunner (2) Spectral line observations for the study of the physical properties of ACTJ0253 at z=4.694, PI J. Rivera, 2015.1.01123.S (3) Resolved CO mapping of lensed ACT DSFGs, PI A. Baker
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
